name: RUM - High 5Xx Error Rate for Network Requests

alertDefProperties.name: RUM - High 5Xx Error Rate for Network Requests
alertDefProperties.description:
This alert monitors high rates of 5xx HTTP status codes returned for network requests as captured through Real User Monitoring (RUM) data. A surge in 5xx errors indicates server-side failures affecting user interactions and page functionality.

The alert is triggered when the proportion of 5xx errors among total network requests exceeds a defined threshold (e.g., 2%) during a specified monitoring period (e.g., 10 minutes).

Monitoring this metric helps ensure backend reliability and availability, which are crucial for maintaining a responsive and functional frontend application.

Customization Guidance:
  - Threshold: Adjust the threshold based on historical backend performance and acceptable failure tolerance for your application.
  - Monitoring Period: Use shorter windows for rapid response to outages or longer ones to track systemic backend issues.
  - Notification Frequency: Configure alerts for persistent or recurring spikes to focus on significant backend disruptions.

Action: If this alert is triggered, investigate server logs, recent backend deployments, load balancer behavior, and API health. Coordinate with backend teams to identify and resolve the root cause of the failures.
